arm_group.description: women undergoing ivf treatment who have BMI>25 and meet the criteria for metabolic syndrome
women undergoing ivf treatment who have BMI>25 and who do not meet the criteria for metabolic syndrome

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine the effect of metabolic syndrome in over-weight
      women on IVF treatment outcomes.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vitro Fertilization Outcomes in Metabolic Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women undergoing ivf treatment

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  inflammatory disease

          -  acute conditions

study_pop.textblock: women undergoing ivf treatment in "Meir" medical center in "Kfar-Saba, Israel

clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Metabolic Syndrome on in Vitro Fertilization Treatment Outcome

primary_outcome.description: success or failure of a treatment will  be determined by beta-Human chorionic gonadotropin test, number of oocyte retrieved or fertilized and embryos quality.
primary_outcome.measure: success or failure of ivf treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 year from intiation of ivf treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 year from initiation of ivf treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: follicle liquid levels of C-reactive protein
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 year from initiation of ivf treatment

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
